titles.title: Recognizing the importance of sun safety, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 109-103.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 45.

action.text: Mr. Bilirakis moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 169.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/7/2005--Passed House amended. Recognizes the importance of sun safety. Encourages all Americans to protect themselves and their children from the dangers of excessive sun exposure. Congratulates organizations like the Sun Safety Alliance for their efforts to promote sun safety and prevent skin cancer. Expresses support for the goals and ideals of National Sun Safety Week (June 5-June 11, 2005).
